messages: 39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:48): I mounted a ntfs partition and put a entry for it in fstab as /dev/wd0f and it mounted fine, then I rebooted and it said /dev/rwd0f file not found and I got booted into single user
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:49): now I can't figure how to get either nano or vi working so I can redit fstab
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:49): when I mount the hdd as mount -u -o rw /
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:49): nano seg faults on me and vi says ENV term not set editor not known
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:50): how can I boot into single user and get a editor working so I can redit fstab?
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:51): sorry I know how to boot into single user, I mean once in, how do I get the editor working
da4d33a374923b308a2846b5e1d74039 (19:51): set your TERM variable
da4d33a374923b308a2846b5e1d74039 (19:51): and try vi again
d1de8be1b40a9326cb906e404e2a1367 (19:51): Xgates: wait were you the same guy who asked on quakenet just?
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:51): how set it, I don't remember?
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:51): just type that?
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:51): ok
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:51): ejk: no
d1de8be1b40a9326cb906e404e2a1367 (19:52): what a conincidence
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:52): ;p
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:52): nightswim: thanks
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:52): brb
3db2edd84fe2671f9b0b3d945e7a94f0 (19:53): Hello people, I need to get altq into netbsd 3.0, where can I find some info how to do it?
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:57): setting TERM=vt100 didn't do anything
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:57): :/
da4d33a374923b308a2846b5e1d74039 (19:58): perhaps export TERM after that
3db2edd84fe2671f9b0b3d945e7a94f0 (19:58): or try "TERM=vt100 vi <file_name>"
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:58): we have a sure bet?
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:58): hehe
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:58): I'd hate to have to keep booting up back and forth
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:59): :)
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:59): TERM=vt100 vi <file_name> will work?
3db2edd84fe2671f9b0b3d945e7a94f0 (19:59): it should work. I don't know if it shall work...
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (19:59): hehe
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:00): ok thanks off to try that
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:09): that worked  :)
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:09): ok I think I added my partition in the NetBSD disk's disklabel
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:09): before I ran mbrlabel -rw wd0
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:10): and in /etc/fstab the entry let me mount it ok
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:10): but when I rebooted it said that /dev/rwd0f was not found
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:10): how can I check if it's in the disk label?
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:12): I don't know if you can run mbrlabel over but it said now --> http://pastebin.ca/72095
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:12): No change; not updating disk label.
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:14): now NetBSD is on wd1 and ntfs is on wd0 that I'm trying to mount
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:14): anyone?
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:19): well I forced it with f
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:19): Updating in-core and on-disk disk label.
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:19): but I can't moun it now, sheesh I mounted this thing before
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:20): what the heck is going on
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:20): xgates@NetBSD ~# mount /mnt/c
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:20): mount: /mnt/c: unknown special file or file system.
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:20): /dev/wd0f /mnt/d ntfs ro,noauto 1 3
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:20): errrrr
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:21): sheesh what am I doing mounting c instead of d
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:21): crap
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:22): sorry anyone here?
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:22): ok my bad SORRY it mounted, BUT then why when I reboot netbsd says /dev/rwd0f not found?
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:27): let me try again
39457dcebd2ee5e39da8dbbce3c8222a (20:27): brb
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:04): i installed my NetBSD on external hard disk i connect via usb
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:04): i have two usb ports
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:05): when i am using the second port to connect another external hard disk
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:05): NetBSD crashes
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:06): i am using NetBSD 3.0.0_STABLE
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (21:06): what does it do when it crashes?
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (21:06): what message do you get?
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:08): i have the same message in console as when i usually connect usb mass storage
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:08): no error message
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:09): but when i tape a simple command like ls
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (21:09): and you connect the 2nd command after netbsd has booted
6e0b43f95c6dc01b211577d9c216a198 (21:09): maybe you damaged your hard drive
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:09): yes i connect it after boot
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (21:10): ok, don't know what it is then.
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (21:10): only thing to try would be compileing a kernel with the usb debug options turned on.
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (21:10): do you have a usb hub btw?
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (21:11): there are some usb devices that are slightly non-standard, if you connect them through a hub it makes them behave better
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:11): i connect it directly to my laptop usb port
436b4c692eda8bdb8bdc762f31344cd8 (21:11): hello imachine_
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:11): my two external hard disks are the same...
5a88748c4bb3824bcfff53e433213900 (21:15): not being a netbsd-guru: maybe at the time you insert the 2nd drive there's a rescan on the usb-bus which causes the 1st harddisc to fail/getting renumbered?
5a88748c4bb3824bcfff53e433213900 (21:18): boot from network and then plug both drives into the system?
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:22): the problem looks like coming from NetBSD
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:22): i tried underr Linux and windows
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (21:23): if it works under linux then it's not the usb hardware problem.
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (21:23): the only way to diagnose the netbsd problem would be with a debug kernel
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (21:23): or with mucking around with the in kernel debugger.
04979480830a3634bec1adf660116a4d (21:24): ok will try with a debug kernel thx everyone
